message: Hey I haven't written good code in a long time and I'd like to improve. I'd love to know what tools - specifically text editors (or IDEs) and resources (documentation) and best practices (x browser code etc) people recommend. All tips welcomed!
@tarikh It's probably worth taking a look at http://diveintohtml5.org
One big remaining Q is what CSS attributes will work across all browsers. Is there a good resource for these?
Nice!
There's http://caniuse.com/
Check out http://html5boilerplate.com/
boilerplate and modernizr is really all you need
http://modernizr.com
https://github.com/paulirish/html5-boilerplate
http://html5rocks.com/ is another great resource.
Combine it with http://compass-style.org/ and you don't have to worry about vendor specific prefixes anymore.
http://sass-lang.com/ is a fantastic way to write stylesheets without repeating yourself all the time.
My editor of choice: Coda (http://panic.com/coda/). What platform are you on?
@mjhagen +1 for Coda!
This footer is too tall.
I'm 12 and what is this? Whoops.
On OS X, I like Coda and also TextMate, thanks for tips folks!
I used to use Textmate but recently switched to Macrabbits Espresso. I highly recommend it.
I have a single script in my head that combines modernizr and the loader from head.js. Then everything else is loaded through head.js at the bottom of the body.
macvim. It takes a bit to get used to but you will be happy you can build more than just html & css very quickly
